Caption: Figure 1: Sample images from the MNIST dataset, with gray-scale from 0 to 255.
Mention:
Each image in the MNIST dataset is represented by a 28 Ã— 28 gray-scale pixel-map, for
a total of 784 features. Each of the 10 digits has roughly 6,000 training examples and
1,000 testing examples. Some of the samples are shown in Figure 1. From the perspective
of using stochastic and online algorithms, the number of features and size of the dataset
are considered very small. Nevertheless, we choose this dataset because the computational
results are easy to visualize. No preprocessing of the data is employed.
